conversation.message: Thank you for raising the crucial topic of student health and wellness. We take our responsibilities in this area very seriously. Our standard protocol dictates that children showing symptoms of common infectious illnesses (e.g., fever, persistent vomiting/diarrhea) must be picked up immediately and remain home until they are symptom-free for 24 hours without medication. We strictly adhere to public health guidelines for reporting and managing communicable diseases. Preventative hygiene is practiced daily through scheduled handwashing (upon arrival, before and after meals, after outdoor play, after toileting), and frequent sanitization of high-touch surfaces and toys. Furthermore, we integrate wellness education into our curriculum, teaching children about healthy habits and emotional regulation. We hope this reassures you regarding the safety measures we have in place.

conversation.message: Thank you, Parent E, for this thoughtful question. It is truly the culture that defines us. While many elements contribute, the single most unique characteristic and defining tradition of Nursery B is our commitment to the 'Celebration of the Learning Journey.' Every Friday, we hold a brief 'Discovery Circle' where children are encouraged to share not just what they succeeded at, but specifically where they faced a challenge or made an 'interesting mistake,' and what they learned from it. This tradition fundamentally shifts the focus from performance to process and resilience, embedding a strong growth mindset from the earliest age. We believe normalizing and celebrating productive failure is essential for fostering lifelong curiosity and confidence. We hope this insight into our core values helps finalize your evaluation.
